para: This is probably the most useful way to create a µ. It creates a µ object with the same pixel size as the given ℑ and then loads the ℑ into the µ.
The filename parameter specifies the file containing the ℑ. The image format is deduced from the file name. Almost any standard format is acceptable.

The microstructure_name parameter specifies the name of the new µ. If it is set to , the µ name will be the same as the filename. In either case, if another µ exists with the same name, <x> will be appended to the name, where x is an integer chosen to make the name unique.

The physical size of the µ and ℑ are taken from the height and width parameters. If one of the parameters is automatic, then its value is computed from the other parameter and the aspect ratio of the image, with the assumption that the pixels are square. If both parameters are automatic, then it is assumed that pixels are of unit width and height, so the physical size of the µ will be numerically equal to its pixel size.

Loading an ℑ on the command line with
oof2 --image imagefile
is equivalent to the command
OOF.Microstructure.Create_From_ImageFile(filename='imagefile', microstructure_name='imagefile', height=automatic, width=automatic).
